title: Graham Linehan's Court Case: What Happened
summary: Graham Linehan, who helped create the TV show Father Ted, was in court for two things. First, he was accused of harassing a trans activist online, but the judge said his posts were not criminal harassment. Second, he was found guilty of damaging someone's phone by hitting it and throwing it on the road. The judge said his online comments were unpleasant but not against the law. Linehan was fined money for the phone damage. He said he did it without thinking and that he was standing up for his beliefs. The case shows how people can disagree about gender identity without breaking the law.
